message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.StringTokenizer;

class TitleApplier {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        String name;
        String[] male = {"Elroy", "Fred", "Graham"};
        String[] females = {"Amy", "Buffy", "Cathy"};
        Scanner scan = new Scanner(System.in);
        
        while(true) {
            System.out.println("Enter a name: ");
            name = scan.nextLine();
            
            if(name.isEmpty()) {
                break;
            }
            
            StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(name);
            String firstName = st.nextToken();
            
            if(isMale(firstName, male)) {
                System.out.println("Mr. " + name);
            } else if(isFemale(firstName, females)) {
                System.out.println("Ms. " + name);
            } else {
                System.out.println(name);
            }
        }
    }
    
    public static boolean isMale(String name, String[] male) {
        for(String m : male) {
            if(name.equalsIgnoreCase(m)) {
                return true;
            }
        }
        return false;
    }
    
    public static boolean isFemale(String name, String[] females) {
        for(String f : females) {
            if(name.equalsIgnoreCase(f)) {
                return true;
            }
        }
        return false;
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The code uses the StringTokenizer class to split the user's input into separate words. It then checks if the first word (assumed to be the first name) matches any of the male or female names. If it does, it adds the appropriate title ("Mr." or "Ms.") before printing the name. If the name does not match any of the predefined male or female names, it is printed as is. The program continues to prompt for names until the user hits "enter" without typing a name.

Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.

Assume that the only female names areAmyBuffyCathyand that the only male names areElroyFredGrahamAll other names will be echoed without a title. Please using this api: StringTokenizer.nextToken.
